definition: Norman Bethune (1890-1939), Canadian doctor, worked for communists in Spanish civil war and for Mao in Yan'an, where he died of blood poisoning
surname Bai

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
favor/grace/kindness
variant of 恩[en1]

sentences.english: Bethune and the unit went into action in a fierce engagement at Kiu Han .
sentences.chinese: 白求恩和医疗队在吕汉的一场激战中投入了战斗。

sentences.english: My knowledge of Dr. Bethune began with an article entitled In Memory of Norman Bethune.
sentences.chinese: 我知道白求恩这个人，起因于一篇文章。

sentences.english: Dr. norman bethune impersonates the spirit of proletarian internationalism.
sentences.chinese: 白求恩医生体现了无产阶级国际主义精神。

sentences.english: This is the scalpel which Norman Bethune used in those days.
sentences.chinese: 这是当年白求恩大夫用的手术刀。

sentences.english: Doctor Baiqiuen (?) devoted life to the Chines Revolutionary Cause.
sentences.chinese: 白求恩大夫把一生都献给了中国革命。

sentences.english: To Dr. Bethune, Montreal is indeed a special place.
sentences.chinese: 蒙特利尔对白求恩来说是个特别的地方。

sentences.english: Doctor Bethune came to China in 1935.
sentences.chinese: 白求恩大夫在1935年来到中国。

sentences.english: Dr. Bethune’s impact on medicine was not singular.
sentences.chinese: 白求恩大夫在医学上的影响是多方面的。

sentences.english: Mrs. Bethune was a great power for good in her ten years in Washington.
sentences.chinese: 白求恩夫人在华盛顿的十年期间是一个伟大的楷模。

sentences.english: Then it was their turn to assess Bethune's work.
sentences.chinese: 随后就轮到大家来鉴定白求恩的工作了。

sentences.english: She is playing Mary McLeod Bethune.
sentences.chinese: 她扮演玛丽麦克劳德白求恩。

sentences.english: Bethune conferred with Nieh about the future work of the medical team.
sentences.chinese: 白求恩和聂讨论了医疗队今后的工作。

sentences.english: But we still need a great number of doctors like Dr. Bethune.
sentences.chinese: 白求恩大夫在医学上的影响是多方面的。

sentences.english: This year we commemorate the 70th anniversary of Dr. Bethune's passing.
sentences.chinese: 今年是白求恩逝世70周年。

sentences.english: Doctor Bethune's internationalist spirit is altogether admirable.
sentences.chinese: 白求恩大夫的国际主义精神十分可佩。

sentences.english: Bethune released Tung's horse and made a wry mouth.
sentences.chinese: 白求恩放开了董的马，噘了噘嘴。

definition: Dwarkanath Kotnis (1910-1942), one of five Indian doctors sent to China to provide medical assistance during the Second Sino-Japanese War
Resist US, help North Korea (1950s slogan)
Agnes Smedley (1892-1950), US journalist and activist, reported on China, esp. the communist side
Paul (name)
warrior in white/medical worker
Lei Feng (1940-1962), made into a model of altruism and dedication to the Party by propaganda from 1963 onwards
martyr
Premier Zhou Enlai 周恩來|周恩来 (1898-1976)
Zhou Enlai (1898-1976), Chinese communist leader, prime minister 1949-1976
Luo Chengjiao (1931-1952), PRC hero of the volunteer army in Korea
John Rabe (1882-1950), German who helped protect Chinese during the Nanking massacre period
martyr of the revolution
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Chi Haotian (1929-), Chinese Minister of National Defense 1993-2003
John Leighton Stuart (1876-1962), second-generation American missionary in China, first president of Yenching University and later United States ambassador to China
Edgar Snow (1905-1972), American journalist, reported from China 1928-1941, author of Red Star Over China
